locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explains the transition from the Old Covenant (Law as external demand) to the New Covenant (Law as internal transformation). It uses the history of Israel, St. Paul's struggle in Romans 7, and modern examples of forgiveness to illustrate the necessity of divine intervention.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Correctly identifies the 'New Covenant' as the root of the 'New Testament' and links Jeremiah to the Last Supper and Pauline theology.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts theological truths and narrates history, but shifts toward the end to promising and inviting the hearer into the reality of the covenant.
voorbeelden: I will make a new covenant (Quoting God/Promising)
The story told by the Old Testament is a story of rebellion (Asserting)
Do not fail to receive this mercy (Directing/Inviting)

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should move from a sense of failure under the law to a state of 'rest' and 'joy' in the mercy of God.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Yes, explicitly mentions the Holy Spirit writing the law on hearts.

voorbeelden: The lure of the forbidden was just as strong in St. Paul’s day as it is in ours.
Jeremiah was one of the two great prophets.
Now hear the Word of the Lord.
Do not fail to receive this mercy.
I’m sure that racial division in America is one of the most formidable problems.
I will never forget one day in my mother’s living room.
I will put my law within them.
I will remember their sin no more.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong, but often mediated through the biblical text rather than the preacher's direct 'I promise you'.

voorbeelden: You may rest secure in the knowledge that he gives himself to you.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the quoted Scripture to perform the action.

indicatoren: Extensive historical recap of Israel's history.
Explanation of the context of Jeremiah's letter.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed about the covenant but remains an observer of the 'story' for the first two-thirds of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Direct present-tense commissives from the preacher's mouth
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' is delayed until the very end (the 'Toezegging').

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High quality, specifically in the final paragraph where the address shifts to 'you'.
voorbeelden: He has come with the key to your prison doors.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used for anecdotes and establishing common ground ('we').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address is saved for the application and the final sacramental invitation.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Yes, used to apply the mercy of the covenant to the 'dear people of God'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Used for the majority of the sermon to describe Israel, Paul, Augustine, and the two women.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that is only bridged in the conclusion.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about the nature of sin and law.

actueel_present.gebruik: The immediate offer of grace in the 'now' of the sermon.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the history of failure (Assertive) to the promise of the New Covenant (Commissive) to the invitation to receive it (Directive).
voorbeelden: The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all (Assertive/Commissive) -> Do not fail to receive this mercy (Directive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern is sound but the 'Assertive' phase is very long.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: He gives himself to you... do not fail to receive this mercy.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite the constative surplus in the middle, the sermon successfully culminates in a performative event where the preacher acts as a mandatory of God's mercy.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: He has come with the key to your prison doors.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long historical recap of Israel's rebellion.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Risk of losing the hearer in information before the encounter.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event in the final three paragraphs where the 'New Covenant' is no longer a topic but a gift offered.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The link between the Word and the upcoming Eucharist ('blood of the new covenant') is explicitly performative.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, through the prophetic 'Thus says the Lord'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, especially in the final address.
tekstueel_bewijs: Now hear the Word of the Lord
Here are his tender words to us

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the agent of internalizing the law.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly, the preacher trusts that God 'recreates our wills'.
tekstueel_bewijs: when God’s law is written in our hearts by the Holy Spirit

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon prepares for and participates in the 'blood of the new covenant'.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, the use of the 'key' and 'prison' imagery.
tekstueel_bewijs: When you come forward to receive his 'blood of the new covenant', you may rest secure.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on past-tense descriptive verbs. Increasing present-tense performative verbs earlier would enhance the 'event' character.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jeremiah was one of the two great prophets who lived through the Babylonian invasion.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Through Jeremiah, God speaks to you in your own sense of exile today.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from historical fact to present address.

voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you today: your sins are remembered no more.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: The 'we' and 'they' dominate for too long.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interject 'you' (singular/plural) into the historical narrative to show its relevance.
voorbeeldzinnen: Like Israel, you too have felt abandoned by God.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of moving from the 'Law' as a constative burden to the 'Gospel' as a performative release.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about his mother's living room; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the Word to change the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the cleverness of the 'beans in ears' story, but in the illocutionary force of the 'mercy' promised at the end.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's success is tied to the shift from 'talking about' the covenant to 'enacting' the covenant for the congregation.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I will remember their sin no more.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - creates the foundation for faith.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He has come with the key to your prison doors.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Very High - changes the hearer's perceived reality.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses narrative as a long 'locutionary' runway for a powerful 'performative' takeoff in the conclusion.
